alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 6:51AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Runoff leading to flooding low lying areas following excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Breathitt, Lee and Owsley. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 646 AM EDT, high water and flooding of low lying areas continued along some of the tributaries of the North Fork and Middle Fork of the Kentucky River. Low water crossings were flooding along portions of the forks of Quicksand Creek in Breathitt County. Although heavy rain has ended, runoff continues. Flooding of low lying areas is ongoing in portions of the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackson, Beattyville, Booneville, Fincastle, Elkatawa, Curt, Yeadon, Gentry, Chenowee, Inverness, Dumont, Howard Creek, Frozen Creek, Guerrant, Fivemile, Canoe, Quicksand, Saldee, Haddix and Copland.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
